intro: Psychotria barahonensis, commonly known as the Barahon wild pepper, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. Psychotria barahonensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
